name: Ian Mosley
description: '''Ian F. Mosley''' (born 16 June 1953) is an English drummer. He is best known for his long-time membership of the [[neo-prog]] band [[Marillion]], which he joined for their second album, ''[[Fugazi (album)|Fugazi]]'', released in 1984. He had previously been an in-demand session drummer. Mosley's abilities have been widely praised, including by former [[Genesis (band)|Genesis]] guitarist [[Steve Hackett]], [[Meshuggah]] drummer [[Tomas Haake]] and critic John Franck of [[AllMusic]]. ''[[Modern Drummer]]'' has characterised him as a "drumming great".
